article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4803 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-athletics category-brent_elementary category-covid category-news category-secondary_campus category-super category-whitaker_elementary

div.p: Finneytown Local School Buildings will be Closed Through May 29, 2020 I normally send the weekly update in the morning, but had a feeling there may be news to share from the Governor’s broadcast today and there was. Today, April 20, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine made an announcement that school buildings are to remain closed to students through the end of this school year. Finneytown Local School Buildings will be closed through the rest of this school year. We know

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4764 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-covid category-news

div.p: This Monday, April 20th, the FLSD School Board Meeting will occur digitally through Zoom. If you would like to view and/or participate in the meeting in real-time please follow the information below at 7:30 on Monday night. A video of the entire Board Meeting will be posted following the meeting. ZOOM Information Topic: FLSD Board of Education MeetingTime: Apr 20, 2020 07:30 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada) Join Zoom Meetinghttps://zoom.us/j/96213224379?pwd=S2NEM2p3dVZpdlhOQXkzOXgzVUVFZz09 Meeting ID: 962 1322 4379Password: pQJC71

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4744 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-covid category-news

div.p: Notification from: Finneytown Local School District ADMIN Hello wonderful Finneytown Families, Monday, April 6, 2020 Welcome to Remote Learning (RL) Week 3. This is certainly not what I thought we would be doing the first week of April, but here we are. School buildings are closed but teaching and learning continues, albeit very differently. I know this is hard and stressful and I applaud all your efforts. You

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4741 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-covid category-news

div.p: With many employers laying off currently, there is a website with employers in Ohio that are hiring. It is here: https://jobsearch.ohio.gov/wps/portal/gov/jobsearch/ The website gives the ability to search for job openings within Ohio by zip code. What an important resource for any parents that have been laid off or furloughed in this difficult time and are looking for work.

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4583 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-brent_elementary category-covid category-news category-secondary_campus category-whitaker_elementary

h3.a: The Community Rallies to Help Finneytown Students With Meals Over Spring Break

div.p: Finneytown students and families are truly grateful to have so many businesses and volunteers willing to provide food and other donations so they have meals. This week, during Spring Break, the Finneytown community came together to provide many meals for our students. Fleming Road UCC and Northminster Church, ECI/Finneytown Oasis (summer camp), and UMC Food Ministry came together to organize, gather, and distribute food to children. In addition, several local businesses donated food to further assist the children and families.

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4580 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-brent_elementary category-covid category-secondary_campus category-whitaker_elementary

div.p: Finneytown Local School Buildings Will Be Closed Through May 1, 2020 On March 30, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine made an announcement ordering all of Ohio’s public, community, and private K-12 school buildings to be closed to students through Friday, May 1, 2020 due to the coronavirus health crisis. Finneytown Local School Buildings will be closed through Friday, May 1, 2020. We know the Governor’s order to extend the closure of school buildings presents a challenge to our families. Our district

div.p: Hello Finneytown Families, Sunday, March 29, 2020I told you I would send another email with info about the COVID-19 State and Federal legislation. article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4569 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-brent_elementary category-covid category-secondary_campus category-whitaker_elementary

h3.a: Update 3/28/20 Return to Remote learning and Food Service

div.p: Happy Spring Break, Saturday, March 28, 2020 I hope everyone had a little time to rest, get outside between rain drops and get used to being at home. Remote Learning will resume Monday, March 30th and that work has already been posted or handed out. If/when we are told buildings will be closed beyond next Friday, April 3rd, we will be in touch to give an update from each

h3.a: Community Resources and Food Service info

div.p: Finneytown Families, Tuesday, March 17, 2020 We have been busy in the district. Students picked up supplies and work and a few picked up meals yesterday. Our school counselors and social

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4516 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-athletics category-brent_elementary category-covid category-news category-secondary_campus category-whitaker_elementary

div.p: Here is the Remote Learning link for the grade levels . It’s all on one page for the parent’s and student’s convenience. If you have questions, please reach out to teachers first, then principals; everyone will be monitoring their emails.

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4508 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-covid

h3.a: Update on Food Service and other Information

div.p: Finneytown Families, Sunday, March 15, 2020 I promised more information when I had it. I want to update you on Lunch and Breakfast and how to pick up Remote Learning work or supplies you have at school. Food Service Our Food Service people have worked all weekend to get things ready. As I mentioned, all food will be prepared and available at the cafeteria at the Secondary Campus (high school). The cafeteria

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-4500 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-athletics category-brent_elementary category-covid category-news category-secondary_campus category-super category-whitaker_elementary

div.p: Dear Finneytown Families, March 14, 2020 Schools are closed but the staff is still thinking about you and your children. They spent yesterday getting lessons ready for next week and the week after Spring Break. Over and over they reached out to me to question if the district was going to still be able to provide meals for students. The answer is yes. Principal newsletters will give you details on Remote Learning for students. I’m including information about meals and
